iati-activity.title: Support to cultural heritage monuments, Phase I
iati-activity.description: This project aims at contributing to the confidence building process through the preservation of Cypriot cultural heritage island wide according to the strategy of the Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage.

Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Othello Tower emergency works completed Other 5 Cultural Heritage site emergency works completed Visibility/completion ceremonies are organized for each completed project

baseline.comment: 11 Cultural Heritage sites selected within the agreed Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage bi-communal list. Selected cultural heritage sites in derelict conditions.

target.comment: T1 - 2 Cultural Heritage sites are kept safe in order to avoid further decline and further collapses T2 - Emergency/Conservation works started at the Othello Tower in Famagusta and Paphos Hamam T3 - Additional works implemented to 2 completed sites upon request of the Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage

actual.comment: T1 Achieved: - Famagusta Mustafa Pasha Mosque â€“ Works were completed on 23 April 2014. - Evretou/Evretu Mosque and Cherkezoi/Cerkez Mosque - Works were completed in December 2014. T2 Achieved: - Works started in Othello Tower and Paphos Hamam T3 Achieved: Additional works completed in Deneia/Denia Mosque and Paphos Hamam.

target.comment: T1 - Bi-communal monitoring visits to project sites are organized and facilitated regularly (at least one every two months) T2 - Conservation works completed and project completion ceremonies organized in 4 cultural heritage sites

actual.comment: T1 - Achieved: One bi-communal monitoring visits to project sites organized every month. T2 - Achieved: Conservation works and project completion ceremonies organized bringing together Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots in Othello Tower in Famagusta (July 2015), Paphos Hamam (March 2015), Evretou/Evretu Mosque (March 2015), Tzerkezoi/Cerkez Mosque (March 2015), Profitis Elia Church in Philia/Serhatkoy (17 November 2015).

iati-activity.title: Support for cultural heritage monuments - Phase II
iati-activity.description: Preservation of Cypriot cultural heritage through conservation and emergency measures for high importance cultural heritage sites agreed by the bi-communal Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage in Cyprus.

document-link.title: Project Document of "Support to cultural heritage monuments of great importance for Cyprus, Phase II

iati-activity.title: Cultural Heritage II
iati-activity.description: Support for the cultural heritage monuments of great importance for the communities of Cyprus.

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - 2 cultural heritage sites to benefit from emergency measures - 8 sites to benefit from conservation designs and/or conservation works

baseline.comment: Study of Cultural Heritage Support to cultural heritage monuments of great importance for Cyprus - Phase 1 List of sites identified by the strategy note of the Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage

target.comment: T1 - At least 1 conservation/emergency measures works completed for 1 cultural heritage site T2 - Conservation designs completed for a)Monastery of Agios Panteleimonas, b)Martinengo Bastion, c)(Land Gate) and d) Venetian Walls in Famagusta and b) Watermill/Aqueduct in Chrysochou/Hirsofu T3 - Tender process initiated and completed for 3 cultural heritage sites

actual.comment: T1 - Achieved: Conservation works completed and inauguration ceremony held at Agios Nicolaos Church in October 2014. T2 - Achieved: Conservation designs completed for a)Monastery of Agios Panteleimona, b)Martinengo Bastion, c)(Land Gate) and d) Venetian Walls in Famagusta and b) Watermill/Aqueduct in Chrysochou/Hirsofu by end of December 2014. T3 - Achieved: Tenders launched and finalised by the end of 2014 for conservation/emergency measures works at Agios Nicolaos Church, Agios Afksentios Church and Old St.George Church. Tender for Agios Panteleimonas Monastery was launched in December 2014 with closing date February 2015.

target.comment: T1- Bi-communal monitoring visits to project sites organised and facilitated regularly (at least one per month) T2 - Conservation works completed in at least 2 cultural heritage sites T3 - Tendering process completed for conservation works at Agios Panteleimonas Monastery

actual.comment: T1- Achieved: One bi-communal monitoring visits/month organised T2 - Achieved: Conservation works completed in Agios Afksentios Church (May 2015), Old St.George Church (14 November 2015), Watermill/Aqueduct in Chrysochou/Hirsofu (Expected completion date: December 2015) T3 - Tendering process completed for conservation works at Agios Panteleimonas Monastery.

iati-activity.description: The restoration of this very important religious monument intends to contribute to the on-going confidence-building process between the Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots communities within the context of cultural heritage preservation and protection.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Construction of nature protection facilities is completed in three sites identified by the European Commission as potential Natura 2000 sites, namely: Karpasia/Karpaz, Alakati/Alagadi, Agia Eirini/Ayairini/Akdeniz.

baseline.comment: Construction was initiated by the European Commission in 2011. The status of the existing buildings in the three sites at the beginning of the projectsimilar; concrete structures are completed, walls are partially completed and some piping for electrical and plumbing have been completed.

target.comment: T1 - Project sustainability review

actual.comment: Achieved - Project sustainability review completed.

target.comment: T1 - Designs review and preparation of new tender documents

actual.comment: T1 - Ongoing - design review expected to be completed by November 2015.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
The following cultural heritage sites are envisaged to benefit from Conservation/Emergency Measures works under Phase 3 of the project:
Karpasia/Karpaz Region: - Agios Georgios Church - Afendrika archaeological site - Agios Philon Church - Agia Triada Church
Paphos region: - Hasan Aga Bath/Hamam - Minaret of Ebubekir mosque
Famagusta region: - St. Anne Church - St. Mary Churh - Carmelite Church - Ravelin (Phase 2 â€“ conservation works)
Archaengelos Michail Church in Lefkonoiko/Gecitkale Mosque in Agios Ioannis/Ayanni Mosque in Agios Nicolaos/Aynikola Conservation works at Agios Panteleimonas Monastery

baseline.comment: Support to monuments of great importance to Cyprus - Phase I and Support to monuments of great importance to Cyprus - Phase II.

target.comment: T1- Establishment of Project Team - Implementation period starting on 03 January 2015.

actual.comment: T2 - Achieved.

target.comment: T1 - Preparation of Terms of Reference for Solicitations for the following cultural heritage sites: a) Paphos cluster (Hasan Aga Bath/Hamam and Minaret of Ebubekir mosque) b) Martinengo Cluster (St. Anne church of Maronites, St. Mary church of Armenians, St Mary of Carmel (Carmelite church), and the Mescit of Tabakhane/Tannerâ€™s Mosque (Jacobite Church). c) Karpaz Cluster (Agios Georgios Church, Afendrika archaeological site, Agios Philon Church, Agia Triada Church) d) Archangelos Michail Church T2- Contracting for designs for at least two of the above

actual.comment: T1- Achieved: all ToRs have been finalised T2 - Achieved: Designs contracts signed for Archangelos Michail Church (July 2015), for Martinengo Cluster - 4 sites (August 2015) and for Karpasia/Karpaz and Paphos cluster (November 2015).

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: A number of missing persons returned to their relatives from the total number of 2,700 missing from both communities.

target.comment:
50 Greek Cypriot and Turkish Cypriot scientists (anthropologists, archaeologists, geologist, psychologists, geneticists, investigators, photographers, workers and bulldozer drivers) working together at burial sites located all over the island in order to exhume human remains and at the CMP Anthropological Laboratory carrying out anthropological analysis of the remains under the coordination of two Cypriot Team Leaders.
15 days of excavation works (digging of wells, trenching, sieving) have been carried out.
CMP website is maintained to keep the general public and the families informed.
Operations staff recruited by UNDP.

actual.comment: Achieved.

target.comment:
50 Greek Cypriot and Turkish Cypriot scientists (anthropologists, archaeologists, geologist, psychologists, geneticists, investigators, photographers, workers and bulldozer drivers) working together at burial sites located all over the island in order to exhume human remains and at the CMP Anthropological Laboratory carrying out anthropological analysis of the remains under the coordination of two Cypriot Team Leaders.
185 days of excavation works (digging of wells, trenching, sieving) have been carried out.
100 bones/bone fragments will have been handled at the CMP Anthropological Laboratory.
CMP website is maintained to keep the general public and the families informed.
CMP supported the relatives of the missing personsâ€™ associations contact with each other and with related associations in Europe and other parts of the world.
Regular and/or ad hoc audits / reviews of the CMP program and on-site training of CMP scientists by consultants/experts (for example, geneticists specialised in mass disasters and /or degraded DNA, archaeologists and forensic anthropologists).
Participation of CMP scientists (anthropologists, archaeologists, geneticists) in specialized training abroad.
Operations staff recruited by UNDP.

actual.comment: Achieved.
